As a former Chief Growth Officer of a global company, Geoff brings real-world expertise in using AI to transform how leaders think and make decisions. In this episode, he reveals how AI can serve as a powerful thought partnerâ€”enhancing strategic focus, overcoming operational overwhelm, and unlocking breakthrough solutions using his CRIT framework. title: Why Balance Is a Lie for Entrepreneurs
description: Mike and Kass Lazerow are seasoned entrepreneurs and investors, best known for co-founding Golf.com and Buddy Mediaâ€”acquired by Salesforce for $745 million. They've backed nearly 100 early-stage startups, contributing to over $10 billion in realized gains. In this episode, they dive into the raw, often messy reality of entrepreneurship, sharing hard-earned lessons from their journey and their latest book. Listeners will gain powerful insights on thriving in uncertainty, embracing the grind, and building successful businesses and lives through focus, transparency, and relentless drive. title: Coffee Day Enterprises Q4 Results: Company narrows loss to Rs 114 crore, revenue up 7%
description: Coffee Day Enterprises Ltd. significantly reduced its consolidated net loss to Rs 114.16 crore in Q4 FY25, compared to Rs 296.40 crore in the previous year. Revenue saw a 7% increase, reaching Rs 268.03 crore. For the entire fiscal year, the company also narrowed its net loss to Rs 143.20 crore, with total consolidated income marginally up to Rs 1,125.

title: Vedanta to raise up to Rs 5,000 crore via debentures
description: Vedanta Ltd's board has approved raising up to Rs 5,000 crore through debenture issuance on a private placement basis. The mining conglomerate reported a significant increase in its consolidated net profit for the March quarter, driven by reduced production costs and increased volumes. The company anticipates completing its business demerger by the end of September.

title: Trump doubles steel tariffs to 50%
description: Trump said U.S. Steel will stay an American company under a deal for Japan-based Nippon to invest in the iconic American steelmaker.

title: Does the Tech Industry Need a Reboot?
description: AlthoughÂ weâ€™veÂ seen great successes come out of the technology sector in recent decades, many criticsÂ â€”Â and even some insidersÂ â€”Â say itâ€™s due for an overhaul. As a longtime Silicon Valley engineer and executive andÂ cofounder of the Grace Hopper Celebration of Women in Computing conference,Â Telle Whitney argues that tech culture is still too closed-off and unwelcoming to different points of view, which leads to products and services thatÂ arenâ€™tÂ as good as they could beÂ â€”Â for consumers and society. She thinks theÂ industryÂ â€”Â and corporate tech departmentsÂ â€”Â can stayÂ innovative while also becoming more inclusiveÂ andÂ shares herÂ advice for leaders who want to help.Â Whitney is the author of the new bookÂ Rebooting Tech Culture: How to Ignite Innovation and Build Organizations Where Everyone Can Thrive.

title: The Secrets Behind Barry Dillerâ€™s Business Success
description: To achieve long-term success in tumultuous businesses like media and entertainment, following formulas and data won't get you there. Barry Diller, the current Chairman and Senior Executive of both IAC and Expedia Group, has built a decades-long career in TV, film, and digital media by going with his instincts and betting on what he views as good ideas with limitless potential. He shares what he's learned about navigating the larger-than-life personalities in Hollywood, developing talent over time, and taking advantage of luck when it comes your way. Diller is the author of the new memoir,Â Who Knew.

title: #2275 Heâ€™s doing SEO on ChatGPT
description: Have you noticed how AI search results are now linking to websites? Todayâ€™s guest runs an SEO agency that helps his clientsâ€™ sites show up in those chat responses. I invited Chirag Kulkarni founder of Taco to talk about how heâ€™s doing it and how he built his agency. Chirag Kulkarni is the founder and CEO of Taco, an AI-powered SEO firm helping brands dominate emerging search platforms. Chirag and his team are building Taco into the go-to partner for companies navigating the shift from Google to generative search. title: #2274 1440: $20+mil / year newsletter
description: After closing a company that failed, Tim Huelskamp decided to keep it simple. He launched an email newsletter that briefed smart people about the dayâ€™s top news. Today his company, 1440, has over 4 million subscribers and generates over $20 million in annual revenue Tim Huelskamp is the co-founder of 1440, the fact-focused daily newsletter. Tim and his team are building 1440 into a trusted source for intellectually curious readers who want an inch-deep, mile-wide view of the world. title: Turf Wars, Tree Men & Murder: Inside the world of Christmas tree selling in NYC
description: Christmas trees are big business in NYC. Running a tree lot takes grit and experience, and even then, it's a tough network to break into. All of the lots in the city are divided into separate territories, owned by only a handful of entrepreneurs. We spent the day working for NYC's busiest Christmas tree seller on Greg Walsh's busiest day of the year to better understand the wild logistics behind NYCâ€™s Christmas tree economy and the tumultuous history of running a lot in this city. Get the Side Hustle Ideas Database: https://clickhubspot.com/ogv
author: HubSpot

title: What does winning a James Beard Award really mean for chefs?
description: Often called the Oscars of the food industry, the James Beard Foundation Awards are among the most coveted for chefs in America. But what's sold and packaged as prestige can sometimes become a distraction from managing the business that got you there. Host Matt Brown is joined by The New York Times food critic Brett Anderson & chef Chintan Pandya (Dhamaka, Semma, Adda, Unapologetic Foods) to learn that an award can not only change a winner's life but an entire industry as a whole.
author: HubSpot

title: Trump says U.S. will double steel tariffs to 50%
description: President Trump will hold a rally Friday at a U.S. Steel plant near Pittsburgh, one week after signaling he had cleared a merger with Japan's Nippon Steel.

title: This is why Jamie Dimon is always so gloomy on the economy
description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has regularly warned that the U.S. economy faces perils, but even as he sounds the alarm, his bank is doing better than ever.

title: Advice Line with Steve Holmes of goba Sports Group

title: Calm: Alex Tew and Michael Acton Smith
description: As a young entrepreneur in the Wild West days of the internet, Alex Tew was drawn to meditation for its simple calming power. Together with fellow tech founder Michael Acton Smithâ€“known for hits like Moshi Monstersâ€“the two brainstormed ways to bring the ancient practice of meditation into the 21st century. In 2011, they bought the domain calm.com, built an app, and started producing meditations and Sleep Stories, narrated by celebrities like Matthew McConaughey and Idris Elba. Despite initial pushback from investors who insisted no one would want to meditate on their phoneâ€“let alone pay for itâ€“ the Calm app grew to a valuation of nearly $2 billion, with 180 million total downloads.Â This episode was researched and produced by Katherine Sypher with music composed by Ramtin Arablouei.
